thread.title: Weary Greek voters trickle to polls in knife-edge election
thread.title_full: Weary Greek voters trickle to polls in knife-edge election | News24

author: news24.com
title: Weary Greek voters trickle to polls in knife-edge election
text:
Athens - Early voters in Greece were thin on the ground on Sunday to elect a government they will entrust with the daunting task of steering the country through painful bailout reforms and meeting the challenge of a growing refugee crisis.
Alexis Tsipras, the firebrand leftist who lost his bitter fight with Europe's establishment to end harsh economic austerity against his country, seeks re-election a month after he resigned as prime minister.
Final polls on Friday showed the race too close to call between his Syriza party and the conservative New Democracy party of Vangelis Meimarakis, who accuses his rival of crippling the economy.
Many Greeks, called to vote in a second national election this year, are disillusioned with a political process that has cut living standards and failed to tackle sky-high unemployment.
